text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] be the span of [mathjaxinline]\{ w_1; w_2\}[/mathjaxinline], where [mathjaxinline]w_1 = \left[ \begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]w_2 = \left[ \begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -3 \\ 1 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline]. Then, for any [mathjaxinline]v\in \mathbb R^3[/mathjaxinline],

tr.td: [mathjax]\mathrm{Proj}_ W(v) = \langle v, w_1 \rangle w_1 + \langle v, w_2 \rangle w_2.[/mathjax]

font.p: The formula given in the video does not work if [mathjaxinline]\{ w_1; w_2\}[/mathjaxinline] is not an orthonormal basis.
